revised_title: Extended Hellmann-Feynman Theorem in Hamiltonian Functions
tldr: The article presents an extended version of the Hellmann-Feynman theorem, which allows for calculating the dependence of expectation values of functions of the Hamiltonian on its parameters. This extended theorem is particularly useful for semi-empirical theories of molecular rate processes and can lead to variationally stable results. The formalism is applicable to Hamiltonians with discrete, continuous, or mixed spectra and can be used to calculate stationary and dynamic information based on matrix elements.
